member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number. Associates the record back to the JobHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely identifies the JobAsmbl record within the JobNum. Assigned by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the JobOper record within the JobAsmbl. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.OpDtlSeq
member.summary: Uniquely identifies an OpDtl. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetupOrProd
member.summary: Identifies which part of the production, setup or production, the resource is required for. Valid values are "S", indicating the resource is RequiredFor the Setup phase of this operation, "P" for Production phase, or "B" meaning Both setup and production phase.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.CapabilityID
member.summary: The user can select the capability the operation is to perform. The system will select the resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ResourceGrpID
member.summary: The user can select a Resource Group for the operation to be performed on. The system will select the actual resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ResourceID
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by the user to uniquely identify the Resource for this operation to be performed on. If a resource was not explicitly assigned this field is blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ConcurrentCapacity
member.summary: Concurrent Capacity is a constraint that prevents a Resource from being overloaded because it has, at a given time, this much capacity. For example, a Resource has 4 racks, and they can be reused, but once they've been selected for an operation, they're tied up until the operation is complete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.DailyProdRate
member.summary: The Daily Prod rate contains the rate required to make 1. This is multiplied with the mfg qty of the job to get the total production qty. This total is then compared to the resource's daily production quantity and with any usage stored in the Shopload record. Once the production limit for a resource has been reached, the Resource has been consumed for that day.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.NumResources
member.summary: This is the number of resources the operation can run on. If multiple resources can perform the required Capability, then up to this many will be employed. This determines the number of setups the system will allow for the operation. However, the number of setups cannot exceed the number of operations. The idea being that once a part is on a machine you will complete the operation on that resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: Total estimated set up hours. Calculated as EstSetHoursPerMch * Machines. It is set to zero if operation qty is zero. This is maintained via the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.EstProdHours
member.summary: The estimated Production run hours for internal operations (JobOper.Subcontract = No) . This is not directly maintainable. It exists so that it will be easier to display than always having to recalculate it when it is needed. It is calculated using the ProdStandard, StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPerPart, QtyPer, EstScrap and EstScrapType. FORMULAS: If StdFormat = "HR" then EstProdHours = ProdStandard. If StdFormat = "PH" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std). If StdFormat = "PM" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std ) / 60. If StdFormat = "OH" then (JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std. If StdFormat = "OM" then ((JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std) / 60. If StdFormat = "HP" then (JobOPer.RunQty/Basis) X Std. If StdFormat = "MP" then ((JobOper.RunQty/Basis) X Std) / 60.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMasDtl.ProdLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ProdComplete
member.summary: A flag indicating if the production is complete for this operation. It is updated via Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetupComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates if Setup is complete on this operation. This flag is only used when the operation has EstSetupHours > 0.00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActProdHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Hours. A summary of non-setup LaborDtl.BurdenHrs. This includes REWORK hours. This is maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActReworkHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActProdRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "P" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActProdHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActProdHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActSetupHours
member.summary: Actual setup hours. A summary of setup (LaborDtl.LaborType = S) labor transactions hours (LaborDtl.Burden). Actual Setup hours reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load based on hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActSetupRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Setup Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "S" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActSetupHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActSetHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetupPctComplete
member.summary: Setup function percent complete. Maintained via labor entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date. This is update via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger procedure. It includes ALL burden costs (Setup, Production and Rework)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ActLabCost
member.summary: Total of ALL labor costs to date. This includes Setup, Production and Rework. Updated via the LaborDtl.Write.p trigger. The Total Cost, updated via the receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ReworkBurCost
member.summary: Total Rework Burden cost todate. This value is also included in the ActBurCost total. It includes both setup & production rework. Updated via LaborDtl\Write.P trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ReworkLabCost
member.summary: Total Rework Labor cost to date. This value is also included in the ActLabCost field. This includes both Setup and Production. Updated via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ResourceLock
member.summary: Resource Lock. If the user explicitly selected a Resource for the JobOpDtl, when they accept the scheduling changes, the WISchedResource will be stored as the explicit Resource. Else the WISchedResource will become the SchedResource and the WISchedResourceGrp will become the ResourceGroup.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SysCreateDate
member.summary: System maintained. Date the JobOpDtl record was added to the database.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SysCreateTime
member.summary: Time in seconds since midnight that the system created the record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.OpDtlDesc
member.summary: Description is initially created when the JobOpDtl is created. If the JobOpDtl is created from a Resource it will be the Resource.Description, if it's created from an ResourceGroup it will be the ResourceGroup.Description. Once set it is not changed by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.EstSetHoursPerMch
member.summary: The estimated set up hours per machine. Default from OpStd.SetupHours. Used to calculate JobOper.EstSetupHours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.OverrideRates
member.summary: If yes then the user has overridden the rates that were on the record when it was inititally created. The initial rates came from the master files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from JobOper.SetupCrewSize. The # of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOpDtlRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from JobOper.SetupCrewSize. Its the number of people it physically takes to setup this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.JobComplete
member.summary: Indicates if "Job" is complete. This is a mirror image of JobHead.Complete. Not directly maintainable. When the Job is completed, then all JobOper records are also marked. This is used to make database access to open operation records more efficient.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OpComplete
member.summary: Indicates if this operation is completed. This is normally set to complete via labor entry transactions. Not maintainable by Job Entry. It can't be reset to "No" if the JobHead.Complete = Yes. Labor entry setting logic is: If SetUpComplete = Yes and EstProdHours = 0 or ProdComplete = Yes and EstSetHours = 0 or both ProdComplete = Yes and SetupComplete = Yes then OpComplete = Yes. This field is also set by PO receipt entry "issue complete" for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.JobNum
member.summary: Job Number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Assembly Sequence # that this Operation is associated with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Job/lot/level. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last JobOper for the job/lot/level and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the JobOper record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OpStdID
member.summary: The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOper to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults. Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: Total estimated set up hours. Calculated as EstSetHoursPerMch * Machines. It is set to zero if operation qty is zero. This is maintained via the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstProdHours
member.summary: The estimated Production run hours for internal operations (JobOper.Subcontract = No) . This is not directly maintainable. It exists so that it will be easier to display than always having to recalculate it when it is needed. It is calculated using the ProdStandard, StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPerPart, QtyPer, EstScrap and EstScrapType. FORMULAS: If StdFormat = "HR" then EstProdHours = ProdStandard. If StdFormat = "PH" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std). If StdFormat = "PM" then (JobOper.RunQty / Std ) / 60. If StdFormat = "OH" then (JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std. If StdFormat = "OM" then ((JobOper.RunQty/OpsPerPart) / Std) / 60. If StdFormat = "HP" then (JobOPer.RunQty/Basis) X Std. If StdFormat = "MP" then ((JobOper.RunQty/Basis) X Std) / 60.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.QueStartDate
member.summary: Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.QueStartHour
member.summary: Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.StartDate
member.summary: Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.StartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DueDate
member.summary: Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.MoveDueDate
member.summary: Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.MoveDueHour
member.summary: Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.ProdLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.AddedOper
member.summary: This indicates if this is an "added operation". An added operation is one that was not planned on.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is the more machines, the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, TOTAL SETUP HOURS ARE ADDED TO THE SQUEEZED PRODUCTION HOURS TO GET THE NUMBER OF HOURS TO BE SCHEDULED. It is however used to calculate the total setup hours on the operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. Its the number of people it physically takes to setup this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The # of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ProdComplete
member.summary: A flag indicating if the production is complete for this operation. It is updated via Labor Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetupComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates if Setup is complete on this operation. This flag is only used when the operation has EstSetupHours > 0.00.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActProdHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Hours. A summary of non-setup LaborDtl.BurdenHrs. This includes REWORK hours. This is maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActReworkHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActProdRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Production Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "P" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActProdHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActProdHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActSetupHours
member.summary: Actual setup hours. A summary of setup (LaborDtl.LaborType = S) labor transactions hours (LaborDtl.Burden). Actual Setup hours reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load based on hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H").

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActSetupRwkHours
member.summary: Total Actual Setup Rework Hours. A summary of rework labor transactions (LaborDtl.BurdenHrs) where LaborDtl.LaborType = "S" and Rework = Yes. This number is also included as part of the JobOPer.ActSetupHours. Maintained via write/delete triggers on the LaborDtl file. Along with JobOper.ActSetHours it is used to reduce the shop load if the system is configured to remove load by actual hours (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = "H"). (See the lib/inopload.i code for load remaining logic)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.QtyCompleted
member.summary: For Non Subcontract operations: A summary of labor transaction detail. (LaborDtl.LaborQty). Labor entry/collection maintains this field. Only the LaborQty for transactions that are Production labor ( LaborType = P ) and Not rework (LaborDtl.Rework = No) are included in this summary. This quantity is used to reduce shop load when the system is configured to reduce load based on quantity completed. (JCSyst.RemoveLoad = Q) For Subcontract Operations this field is updated by the Purchased Receipt process. The detail records are in the PartTran file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetupPctComplete
member.summary: Setup function percent complete. Maintained via labor entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstScrap
member.summary: EstScrap = a number representing either a scrap qty or a scrap percent depending on the value of EstScrapType field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.IUM
member.summary: Inventory UOM

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost for the SubContract operation. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Default the JobHead.PartNum or JobAsmbl.PartNum depending on the JobMtl.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.Description
member.summary: Description used only for subcontract operations

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity. This is a calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer) + Scrap. The assembly qty is either the JobHead.ProdQty if JobOPer.AssemblySeq = 0 or (JobAsmbl.RequireQty - JobAsmbl.PullQty) if JobOPer.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIName
member.summary: This field is blank or contains the UserID. When not blank it indicates that the operations schedule has been changed and is considered as being in a "What If" mode. This field is also used as part of an index which allows the system to quickly find the operations that need to be reset to "Actual Schedule".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIMachines
member.summary: This is the What-If number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Setup by and for scheduling from the Machines field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIQueStartDate
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIQueStartHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled queue start hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: What if Scheduled production start date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the What If "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to begin.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: What If Scheduled production due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling. It represents the "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" when this operation is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIMoveDueDate
member.summary: What-If Scheduled move due date. Not directly maintainable, updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIMoveDueHour
member.summary: What-if Scheduled move due hour offset from the beginning of the work day. This field is established by scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WIHoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "What If" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WILoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding "What-If" load starts at. Updated by the JobOper write trigger. (See LoadDate)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.WILoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding "What-If" load. Related to WILoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActBurCost
member.summary: Total Burden cost to date. This is update via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger procedure. It includes ALL burden costs (Setup, Production and Rework)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ActLabCost
member.summary: FOR NON-SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: Total of "ALL" labor costs to date. This includes Setup, Production and Rework. Updated via the LaborDtl.Write.p trigger. FOR SUBCONTRACT OPERATIONS: The Total Cost, updated via the receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ReworkBurCost
member.summary: Total Rework Burden cost todate. This value is also included in the ActBurCost total. It includes both setup & production rework. Updated via LaborDtl\Write.P trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ReworkLabCost
member.summary: Total Rework Labor cost to date. This value is also included in the ActLabCost field. This includes both Setup & Production. Updated via the LaborDtl\Write.p trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.HoursPerMachine
member.summary: The Number of Hours per machine per day that this operations "actual" schedule is based on. This is for "Inbetween" days, not first or last days. It is a copy of WrkCenter.HoursPerMachine field at the time of scheduling. Used in logic of maintaining the ShopLoad records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.LoadDate
member.summary: Date at which the operations current outstanding load starts at. Ex: Op schedule is 2/1/97 - 2/10/97, initially LoadDate = 2/1/97. As load is relieved through labor processing the LoadDate moves forward accordingly. When 1/2 completed the LoadDate would be 2/5/97. This field is primarily used by the Scheduling Board to calculate the graphical image of outstanding load. Updated by the JobOper write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.LoadHour
member.summary: "Hour offset from the beginning of the work day" for the operations outstanding load. Related to LoadDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.ReloadNum
member.summary: Internally used field to prevent redundant read of JobOper during execution of "Reloader" program. (See WrkCenter.ReloadNum)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SndAlrtCmpl
member.summary: Controls if an alert is to be sent when this JobOper is completed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RcvInspectionReq
member.summary: Indicates if Inspection is required when items are received to this JobOper (subcontract only). Inspection may also be enforced if the related PartClass, Vendor, PODetail have their "RcvInspectionReq" fields set to Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.JobEngineered
member.summary: Identical to JobHead.JobEngineered. ShopLoad capacity is only allocated to Jobs where JobEngineered = YES.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.EstSetHoursPerMch
member.summary: The estimated set up hours per machine. Default from OpStd.SetupHours. Used to calculate JobOper.EstSetupHours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Part Revision number. Pertains to subcontracting operations only. An optional field. Related JobAsmbl.RevisionNum is used as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.AutoReceiptDate
member.summary: Currently not used. Prep for future development.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.LastLaborDate
member.summary: The labor date of the last labor transaction that was posted to this operation. Used by the JobOper write trigger Auto Receieve logic.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.CallNum
member.summary: The service call that this operation belongs to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.CallLine
member.summary: The Service Call Line that this operation relates to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.LaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on an operation. Time per hour per technician. in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.BillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. in base currency. This field considers the percentage coverage of a warranty or contract.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DocLaborRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. Does not consider warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DocBillableLaborRate
member.summary: Billable Labor rate used for time on a service. Time per hour per technician. In Customer currency. considers warranty or contract

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.Billable
member.summary: FS - Is this a billable operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.BillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Unit Price for the subcontract in base currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DocBillableUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Billable Price per unit for the subcontract in customers currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: FS - Unit Price for the for the Subcontract in Customer currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.LaborEntryMethod
member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated) or "B" - Backflush.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each,"C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.FAQty
member.summary: The quantity requested for first article inspection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.QtyStagedToDate
member.summary: The "to date" quantity that has been moved to the input Warehouse/Bin of the subsequent operations ResourceGroup/Resource input Warehouse/Bin. This is NOT A balance. It is a "to date" value. It is not reduced as it is consumed. Used in calculation of "Outstanding" WIP in the Request Material/WIP program (ame30-dg.w). Only updated if the Advanced Material Mgmt module is installed and only by transactions which "move" the WIP material in/out of the staging area (Issues, Returns).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this job operation requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required. This only applies to subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this job subcontract operation. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SetupGroup
member.summary: Used to group operation to save on setups.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RestoreFlag
member.summary: Used to determine if this record was modified during the last What-If Schedule Restore. The contents are Date-Time. Example: "04/11/02-34221".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary JobOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the JobOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid JobOpDtl. The JobOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.OpDesc
member.summary: Operation Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.KitDate
member.summary: Kit Date. Not directly maintanable. Updated via the scheduling process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.GlbRFQ
member.summary: Global RFQ flag. Used in Consolidated Purchasing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.BookedUnitCost
member.summary: Booked Unit Cost

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RecalcExpProdYld
member.summary: Initially defaulted to false. This flag is set to true at the time JobOper.ProdComplete is set to true if JobHead.ProductionYield = true and OpMaster. PrdYldRecalcExpected = true and the actual completed qty for the operation vs. the expected completion qty is out of variance based on the under percentage set in OpMaster. This flag is used by the production yield recalculation logic to determine if recalculation is required for a job. This field is maintained by the system only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.UserMapData
member.summary: Character field that will contain the coma separated data that has been returned from Microsoft Projects. This data will be retained exactly as it was returned from MSP. This field will NOT be editable within Vantage.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.RoughCutSched
member.summary: When true this would signify that this operation was rough cut scheduled - meaning the operation would have start and end dates but no supporting resourcetimeused or shopload records.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SendAheadType
member.summary:
Determines the scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation, offset which will be either
calculated (or entered) on the primary operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces, percentage
of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The secondary operation
will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcJobOperRow.SendAheadOffset
member.summary:
Scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces,
percentage of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The
secondary operation will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: This field along with Company and QuoteNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last QuoteDtl record for the Quote and the adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: An integer that uniquely identifies the Assembly record within the Quote/Line. Assigned by the system one greater than the last QuoteAsm record on file for the given quote/line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number for this assembly. Cannot be blank. It does not have to be valid in the Part master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.Description
member.summary: Description for the Part on the assembly record. This cannot be blank. Use Part.Description if valid Part record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the assembly. An optional field. Use the Part.RevisionNum as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.QtyPer
member.summary: The production Quantity required for this assembly per one of it's Parent Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.IUM
member.summary: The unit of measure for this assembly. Use the Part.IUM as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this assembly material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.Parent
member.summary: Sequence number of the Parent Assembly. 0 means no parent assembly (i.e. this is the final assembly). Cannot be negative like the other pointers because this one shows up in a browser.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.PriorPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the prior assembly that is on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a PriorPeer assembly. This is automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the last assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the NextPeer is -1). Then NextPeer of that assembly gets updated with this assembly's sequence number and this assembly gets its PriorPeer field updated with the sequence number from that assembly which was found. -1 means that there is no prior assembly (i.e. it is the first assembly of its peers).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.NextPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the Next Assembly on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a NextPeer assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the first assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the PriorPeer is -1). Then the PriorPeer of that assembly is updated with this assembly's sequence number and then this assembly's NextPeer gets updated with the sequence number from the assembly that was found. -1 means that the assembly is the last assembly of its peers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.Child
member.summary: Seq # of this assembly's very first subassembly. This is known as the Child assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the Parent assembly record and if its child is -1, update it with this assembly's seq #.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Optional field for Engineering Drawing Number. Defaulted from BomHead.DrawNum during methods pull functions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job Assembly comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.BomSequence
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which is used as part of an index to organize the QuoteAsm records into a Bill of Material fashion sequence.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.BomLevel
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which represents the "Level of Indention" of the QuoteAsm in reference to the Bill of Material structure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: A system maintained field. This is how many of the assemblies are required to produce ONE of the END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as the ( Parents RequiredQty X QtyPer). This field needs to be refreshed whenever a change is made to the production quantity in any of its parents or when its QtyPer. The refresh may also occur if the structure of the assemblies is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.Template
member.summary: Indicates if this quote assembly is considered a "Template". Template lines appear in the browse of quotes that can be copied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.AutoRecOpr
member.summary: The operation number (Quote.OprSeq) that is marked to do the Automatic Receipt to inventory. Note: Zero = no operation is set to perform the auto receive into inventory function. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Auto Receive" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.FindNum
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION - Characters used on the parent assembly drawing to show where assembly is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.FinalOpr
member.summary: The sequence of the operation that is to be considered as the operation which indicates the quantity complete for the Job/Assembly. In other words this operations completed quantity = Job/Assembly completed. Note: Zero = no operation is set and that the system should use the last operation to determine quantity complete. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Final Operation" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: Used for scheduling a quote. This date is only valid for the quantity and date the user entered for Quote Scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling, and it only valid for the Date/Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: Used for scheduling. Only valid for the Date and Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: Used for scheduling. Only valid for the Date and Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: An assembly record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the QuoteOper.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this assembly is required at the very beginning of the production job. The related operation is also used to calculate scheduled start date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteAsmRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.summary: This field along with Company and QuoteNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the QuoteDtl record for the Quote and the adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.PartNum
member.summary:
The user's Internal Part number used to identify line item part. It cannot be blank. It does not have to exist in the Part table.
A default should be made when the QuoteDtl.XPartNum is changed. The PartNum and XPartNum fields work together in providing defaults for each other. Default when a valid record is found in the PartXRef table. NOTE THE PART CROSS REFERENCE LOGIC IS NOT INCLUDED IN RELEASE 1.0 ... PLAN FOR FUTURE

member.summary: An optional field that is used if the customer has a different Part number than the users internal part number. The XPartNum and PartNum can provide defaults for each other via the CustXPrt table.. The XPartNum can be blank, does not have to exist in the CustXPrt table. THIS FIELD WILL BE USED TO PASS THE VALUE ALONG TO ORDER ENTRY.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.MfgDetail
member.summary: An internally used flag field which indicates if Manufacturing Details exist for this quote line item. It is set to "Yes" if any QuoteOpr or QuoteMtl records exist for the quote line. This is controlled via write/delete triggers on the QuoteOpr and QuoteMtl files. Used by the "Get Detail" function in job entry so that only QuoteDtl record that MfgDetail = Yes are shown in the browser.

member.summary: The quantity expected to be ordered. (In selling unit of measure)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.SellingExpectedUM
member.summary: Unit of measure (how it is sold/issued) for the SellingExpectedQty. Use the default Part.SUM if its a valid Part else use the global variable Def-UM which is established from XaSyst.DefaultUM.

member.summary: Allows Sales Rep to enter a percentage to factor the calculated revenue potential for the quote line

member.summary: The date this line was last updated

member.summary: The last User Is that updated this Quote

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DiscountPercent
member.summary: The line item discount percent. It has nothing to do with price break discounts. It is a flat discount percent that defaults from the QuoteHed.DiscountPercent, which was originally defaulted from the Customer.DiscountPercent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.Discount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item. It can be left zero. This is calculated using the QuoteDtl.DiscountPercent * (QuoteQty * UnitPrice). This field can also be directly updated by the user, However it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, UnitPrice or OrderQty fields are changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DocDiscount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item Converted to the customers currency. It can be left zero. This is calculated using the QuoteDtl.DiscountPercent * (QuoteQty * UnitPrice). This field can also be directly updated by the user, However it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, UnitPrice or QuoteQty fields are changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ExpectedRevenue
member.summary: Expected revenue for this line. Calculated from SellingExpectedQty and Unit Price, discount and SalesRepFactor

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DocExpectedRevenue
member.summary: Expected revenue for this line in customer currency. Calculated from SellingExpectedQty and Unit Price, discount and SalesRepFactor

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ReqShipDate
member.summary: The requested ship date for the sales order

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.OrderQty
member.summary: The quantity to be used when a Sales order is created. (In selling unit of measure)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.SellingExpFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the customers unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is sold in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Inventory Qty * Conversion Factor = Selling Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.MultiRel
member.summary: Indicates that the order line made from this quote line should have multiple releases. Informational only.

member.summary: Same as Unit price except that this field contains the unit price computed from the input based pricing in a configuration. If price breaks exist this price should be used as the base price instead of the one found in the part table.

member.summary: This is the base price for inputs based pricing of a configuration. The price of inputs are added to this price to get the ConfigUnitPrice.

member.summary: The Expected Quantity (total qty of related quote lines) used to find price when quantity based discounting is applied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ListPrice
member.summary: This is the price returned by the price list before quantity based or order value based discounts are applied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DocListPrice
member.summary: Same as List price except that this field contains the list price in QuoteHed).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.OrdBasedPrice
member.summary: This is the unit price after quantity based or order value based discounts are applied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DocOrdBasedPrice
member.summary: Same as Order Based price except that this field contains the unit price in the customer currency (converted using the exchange rate on QuoteHed).

member.summary: This is the Price Group ID used to price the quote line with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.OverridePriceList
member.summary: Indicates if the user selected a price list different from the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.PricingValue
member.summary: The Expected Order Value (total extended price of related quote lines) used to find order value break when value based discounting is applied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ExpUnitPrice
member.summary: This is the unit price based on the expected quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DocExpUnitPrice
member.summary: This is the unit price (in customer currency) based on the expected quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ExpPricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Used to calculate the extended unit price for the line item. The logic is to divide the QuoteDtl.SellingExpectedQty by the appropriate "per" value and then multiply by expected unit price. Use the Part.PricePerCode as a default. If Part record does not exist then default as "E"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.MiscQtyNum
member.summary: An internally used integer assigned by the system to provide a unique key to the QuoteQty file. This indicate what QuoteQty break should be used to get the related miscellaneous charges.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.Engineer
member.summary: The Quote Line has been Engineered.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ReadyToQuote
member.summary: Indicates if Engineering details are complete/valid if the EngineerReq field is marked as Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitAllowUpdate
member.summary: Indicates if component lines can be added, deleted and modified during quote entry. This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitShipComplete
member.summary: Indicates if the parent kitted part must be shipped complete or if kit components can be shipped in varying degrees of completeness. This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents. If this field is set to "No", then KitPricing must be set to "C".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitBackFlush
member.summary: Indicates if all components are to be backflushd when a kit parent item is shipped. This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitPrintCompsPS
member.summary: Indicates if kit components are to be printed on packing slips. If KitShipComplete is "Yes",then this field must be set to "Yes" as well. This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitPrintCompsInv
member.summary: Indicates if kit components are to be printed on invoices. If KitShipComplete is "Yes", then this field must be set to "Yes" as well. This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitPricing
member.summary: Indicates how kits will be priced. Values are: P = Parent Pricing (The price is otained from the sales price for the kit parent item), C = Component Pricing (The price is obtained from a rollup of kit component items). This field is only relevant for quote lines which are kit parents.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitParentLine
member.summary: The quote line number of the parent kit item. This is only relevent for quote lines which are kit parent or component lines. If the KitParentLine equals the QuoteLine then this is a kit parent line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitQtyPer
member.summary: Component quantity required to fulfill one kit parent. This field is only relevant on a quote line which is a kit component.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.DisplaySeq
member.summary: This field controls the order in which quote lines are displayed. DisplaySeq is a decimal number where the whole number portion is used to sequence normal quote lines and the decimal portion is ued to sequence kit components under their associated kit parent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.ProjectID
member.summary: Project ID of linked project. Must exist on the Project table. Can be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.SellingFactorDirection
member.summary: Indicates how Factor is used in calculations. If M (multiply), the Factor is multiplied, if D (divide) the factor is divided.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.MakeDirect
member.summary: To indicate whether or not the line is make direct

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.PhaseID

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitFlag

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteDtlRow.KitsLoaded

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Quote number is an integer which is used to uniquely identify a quote within the system. This is automatically assigned by the system when the user requests to create a new quote. To create a new quote the user either takes an "add" option or leaves the Quote Number fill-in zero. The system generates a number by finding the quote number of the last record on file and then a 1 to it. It then uses the greater of Last quote number + 1 or the EQSyst.StartQuoteNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CustNum
member.summary: Contains the internal Customer number that the links the quote to the customer master. This is not directly entered by the user. Instead the CustID is entered which provides the CustNum from the customer master. The quote must reference a valid Customer master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.EntryDate
member.summary: Date that quote was created in the system. Not user maintainable. Set equal to the system date when record was created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.PrcConNum
member.summary: Contains the key value for the Purchasing Contact. This can be blank or it must be valid in the CUSTCNT table. Use the CUSTOMER.PRIMPCON as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.QuoteComment
member.summary: Contains comments about the overall Quote. These will be printed on the Quote form.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.DueDate
member.summary: Date that quoted needs to be quoted by. Defaulted as Today + EQSyst.DueDays. This will be used to browse unquoted quotes in order by when they need to get quoted. Like a work queue for the quoters.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.Quoted
member.summary: Indicates if the quote has been quoted. That is, the details have been entered, prices have been determined and is ready to be sent to the customer. The quoter considers this quote complete. Toggling this field also sets the DateQuoted equal to the current system date.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.DateQuoted
member.summary: Date that the quoter considered the quoting process for this quote complete. This field is not accessible until Quoted = Yes. At which time this gets defaulted to system date. It is overrideable. A change to this field triggers a refresh to ExpirationDate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ExpirationDate
member.summary:
The date when this quote expires. This field is not maintainable until the quote is marked as Quoted = Yes. At which time the DateQuoted is generated and then the ExpirationDate is set to DateQuoted + EQSyst.ExpirationDays.
This date is also used as part of the quote purging criteria testing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.FollowUpDate
member.summary: Date that this quote should be followed up with the prospect by. This can be left blank. When the quote is completed (i.e. Quoted = TRUE) this field is defaulted to DateQuoted + EQSyst.FollowUpDays and is user overrideable. If EQSyst.FollowUpDays = Zero(0) then no default is generated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.Reference
member.summary: A reference field that could be used to enter the customer RFQ # or any other piece of useful information.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CheckOff1
member.summary: Optional Quote check off # 1. The label for this field is found in EQSyst. If the label field is blank then field should be invisible. These "check offs" could be used for selecting quotes. An example would be a "Engineering" or "Purchasing" check off.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CheckOff2
member.summary: Optional check off # 2.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CheckOff3
member.summary: Optional check off # 3.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CheckOff4
member.summary: Optional check off # 4.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CheckOff5
member.summary: Optional check off # 5.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.Expired
member.summary: Indicates if the Quote has expired. A quote is expired when QuoteHed.ExpirationDate < Today. Each time a user logs on the system does a quick check for any unexpired quotes that have an expiration date < Today and sets them as expired. This field is also set during the QuoteHed write trigger.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.FlwAlrtSnt
member.summary: System maintained flag - set to yes when the quote follow up alert has been sent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.DueAlrtSnt
member.summary: System maintained flag - set to yes when the quote due date alert has been sent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ExchangeRate
member.summary: Exchange rate that will be used for this order. Defaults from CurrRate.CurrentRate. Conversion rates will be calculated as System Base = Foreign value * rate, Foreign value = system base * (1/rate). This is the dollar in foreign currency from the exchange rate tables in the newspapers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.LeadRating
member.summary: A = High, Z = Low

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.TerritoryID
member.summary: Link to the territory Id for this LOQ

member.summary: Link to Task set

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CurrentStage
member.summary: Describe the type of Quote this is. LEAD = Lead OPPO = Opportunity QUOT = Quote

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ParentQuoteNum
member.summary: Link to the parent Quote. This Quote is a for the same job as the parent but for a different customer. This quotes revenues estimates won't be included in the sales managers figures.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ActiveTaskID
member.summary: The Currently active Stage changing task

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.LastTaskID
member.summary: The Last Complete Milestone task

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ExpectedClose
member.summary: The date this quote is expected to close.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ReasonType
member.summary: Indicates the Type of reason for closing this quote. "W" Win CRM "L" - Loss CRM, "T" Task CRM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ReasonCode
member.summary: Select from list of Win or loss reason codes depending on the setting if the conclusion field

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ConfidencePct
member.summary: Allows Sales Rep to enter a percentage to factor the calculated revenue potential

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.DiscountPercent
member.summary: Used to establish a discount percent value which will be used as a default during Quote line entry. It can be left as zero. Use the CUSTOMER.DISCOUNTPERCENT field as a default. Refreshed whenever QUOTEHED.CUSTOMER field changes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ShipToNum
member.summary: Indicates which customer ship to is to be used as the default for the Order release record created from this Quote. It can be blank or it must be valid in the SHIPTO table. Use the CUSTOMER.SHIPTONUM as the default on new Quotes or when the QuoteHED.CUSTNUM is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ShpConNum
member.summary: Establishes the Shipping Contact to be used as default on the Order release record created from this Quote. Contains the key value for the shipping contact in the CUSTCNT table. Can be blank or must be valid in the CUSTCNT table. Use the Customer.PrimScon as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.QuoteClosed
member.summary: This quote is no longer updatable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ClosedDate
member.summary: The date that the Quote was closed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ShipViaCode
member.summary: Contains the key value of the record in the "SHIPVIA" table. It can be left blank or must be valid in the 'SHIPTO" table. Use the CUSTOMER.SHIPVIA as the default when the CUSTNUM field is changed and the SHIPTO is blank. Use SHIPTO.SHIPVIA when CUSTNUM or SHIPTO fields are changed and the SHIPTO is not blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.MktgCampaignID
member.summary: Link to the Marketing Campaign related to this Quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.MktgEvntSeq
member.summary: Link to the marketing event associated with this record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.CallTypeCode
member.summary: CallType code from the CallType table. Identifies what type of communication this is. For example e-mail, phone, visit, etc.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.PONum
member.summary: This is an optional field used to enter the customers Purchase Order Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.TermsCode
member.summary: Contains the key value of the record in the TERMS table which indicates the sales terms established for this Opportunity/Quote. On change of QutoeHED.CUSTNUM use the CUSTOMER.TERMS field as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.Ordered
member.summary: Indicates that the one or more detail line items have been ordered on this quote. Note: This can be set via 3 methods. 1 - When the task is marked as a win and order is created, 2 - Via the Order Entry Get function, 2 - Via the Order Entry Add from Quote Line function.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ApplyOrderBasedDisc
member.summary: Indicates if order based discounting needs to be applied to the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.AutoOrderBasedDisc
member.summary: Indicates if order based discounting should be applied automatically or manually triggered by user as menu option.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.BTCustNum
member.summary: Bill To Customer Number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.LockRate
member.summary: When checked the exchange rate defaults the currency's exchanged reate, but the user can change it. When not checked the exchange rate defaults the currecy's exchange rate, and the field is disabled

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ChangedBy
member.summary: Userid of user who made the last change to this record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ChangeDate
member.summary: The date that the record was last changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ChangeTime
member.summary: The time that the record was last change (seconds since midnight)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ReadyToCalc
member.summary: This flag will be used to indicate if the Quote is ready for calculations. When set to true, tax calculations will take place whenever a save takes place for any tables tied to the quote which could affect taxes (QuoteDtl, QuoteHed, QuoteMsc, etc). It defaults from EQSyst.QuoReadyToCalcDflt field when an order is created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteHedRow.ExportRequested
member.summary: This field is used to store a code that represents the external system that the Quote is being exported to (ex. PDM). This field is short lived, it is used to instruct the write trigger logic to create IM records for certain types of external systems. After creating the IM records, the trigger logic should immediately clear the field.

member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: The QuoteLine that record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.MtlSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material record within a specific Quote/Line/Assembly. System assigned using the next available number, determined by reading last QuoteMtl record on the Quote/Line/Assembly and then adding one to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of required material. Does not have to be valid in Part master file, but must not be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.Description
member.summary: Description of the material. Cannot be blank

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Quantity required per one of the Parent item. This is a factor used in calculating the total material requirement.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.IUM
member.summary: The issue/usage unit of measure for this material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Expected Purchasing lead time (in days) for the material. This is passed along to the job if the item gets manufactured.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: A material record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the QuoteOpr.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this material is required at the very beginning of the production job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvagePartNum
member.summary: Part number for Salvaged scrap from this material record. An optional field. This does not have to be valid in the Part master. Salvage info is mainly to allow the credit back to a job for this type of scrap via Salvage receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageDescription
member.summary: Description of Salvaged material. Use Part.Description for a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageQtyPer
member.summary: A factor that multiplied by the RequiredQty for the material results in the expected total salvage quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageUM
member.summary: Default Unit of measure for the Salvaged Part. Default from the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageMtlBurRate
member.summary: The salvage material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SalvageEstMtlBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated salvage Mtl Burden Unit Credit. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Comments for manufacturing about this material record. These comments are printed on manufacturing reports, such as the router. For valid Parts use the Part.MfgComment as a default. View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Used to identify a default vendor. Use the Part.VendorNum as a default. This will be used as a default for purchasing and miscellaneous receipts. This field is not directly maintainable; instead it's assigned by having the user either entering the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. An optional field, but if entered must be valid.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.BuyIt
member.summary: Indicates if this material is to be Purchased for the Job. If this is a non inventory part then this is "Yes" and can't be changed. If this is a valid Part then set it to "NO" but the user can override it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.PurComment
member.summary:
Comments for purchasing about this material record on this job. These comments will be used as defaults to the PODetail.Comment field when the purchase order references this JobMtl record.
View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for this material. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the material cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Mtl Burden Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: Required Qty per ONE of the END ITEM. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Parent Required Qty X QtyPer). The parent qty is one if assemblySeq zero else (QuoteAsmbl.RequireQty) if AssemblySeq > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur for this material. The scrap increase the Required quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a required quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.FixedQty
member.summary: Indicates if the QtyPer field represents a "Fixed Quantity". If Yes, then the required quantity = QtyPer. That is, the quantity does not change as the number of pieces being produced changes. This can be used to enter Tooling or Fixture type of requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.FindNum
member.summary: Characters used on the drawing to show where material is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.Class
member.summary: The Inventory class that this Part belongs to. The Class field can be blank or must be valid in the PartClass master file. CLasses could be set up for different type of raw materials. It will primarily be used as a report selection parameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.APSAddResType
member.summary: Advanced Planning and Scheduling Additional Resource Type. Indicates whether the Part should be treated as an AdditionalResourceType by eScheduler. 'I' to ignore in eScheduler 'M' to treat at Material in eScheduler 'A' to treat as AddResType in eScheduler

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this quote material requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RFQVendQuotes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RFQNum

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RFQLine

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.RFQStat

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.PBrkQty01
member.summary: Price break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs. The quantity represent the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price established in PBCost array. Not all 4 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the material unit cost to use by first calculating the material Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the PBQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost is used else EstUnitCost is used.

member.summary: GroupSeq
