member.summary: Revision identifier for this row. It is incremented upon each write.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.OrigGroupSeq
member.summary: By storing the original Group Sequence of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteMtlRow.EstMtlUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Material Unit Cost component of the EstUnitCost. Defaults from the Part table if valid PartNum. This field will only have value if the part is a manufactured stock part. This is a subcomponent of the EstUnitCost where:

member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: Used to link back to the QuoteLine. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: Used to link back to the QuoteAsmbl record. System assigned.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.OprSeq

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.CapabilityID
member.summary: The user can select the capability the operation is to perform. The system will select the resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ResourceGrpID
member.summary: The user can select a Resource Group for the operation to be performed on. The system will select the actual resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ResourceID
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by the user to uniquely identify the Resource for this operation to be performed on.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SetupHours
member.summary: The standard setup hours for the operation. This is the setup time required for each machine.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ProdHours
member.summary: Production hours for this operation. It is the total hours, as though the operation were running on a single machine.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.NumResources
member.summary: This is the number of resources the operation can run on. If multiple resources can perform the required Capability, then up to this many will be employed. This determines the number of setups the system will allow for the operation. However, the number of setups cannot exceed the number of operations. The idea being that once a part is on a machine you will complete the operation on that resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate used for setup time. Used as a default in Job and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: Burden rate used for production time on an operation. Job and Quoting use it as a default when entering operation details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: The labor rate used for setup time. Used as a default in Job and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for production time on an operation. Job and Quoting use it as a default when entering operation details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SetupOrProd
member.summary: Identifies which part of the production, setup or production, the resource is required for. Valid values are "S", indicating the resource is RequiredFor the Setup phase of this operation, "P" for Production phase, or "B" meaning Both setup and production phase.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.OpDtlDesc
member.summary: Description is initially created when the QuoteOpDtl is created. If the QuoteOpDtl is created from a Resource it will be the Resource.Description, if it's created from an ResourceGroup it will be the ResourceGroup.Description. Once set it is not changed by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.OverrideRates
member.summary: If yes then the user has overridden the rates that were on the record when it was inititally created. The initial rates came from the master files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ConcurrentCapacity
member.summary: Concurrent Capacity is a constraint that prevents a Resource from being overloaded because it has, at a given time, this much capacity. For example, a Resource has 4 racks, and they can be reused, but once they've been selected for an operation, they're tied up until the operation is complete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.DailyProdRate
member.summary: The Daily Prod rate contains the rate required to make 1. This is multiplied with the mfg qty of the job to get the total production qty. This total is then compared to the resource's daily production quantity and with any usage stored in the Shopload record. Once the production limit for a resource has been reached, the Resource has been consumed for that day.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from QuoteOper.SetupCrewSize. It's the number of people it physically takes to set up this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from QuoteOper.ProdCrewSize. The number of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SysRevID
member.summary: Revision identifier for this row. It is incremented upon each write.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SysRowID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this row. The value is a GUID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.RowMod
member.summary: RowMod

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOpDtlRow.SpecifiedProperties
member.summary: SpecifiedProperties

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: The QuoteLine that record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Quote/Line/Assembly. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last QuoteOpr for the QuoteLine/Asm and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the QuoteOpr record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.OpStdID
member.summary:
The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOPer to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults.
Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: The TOTAL estimated set up hours FOR ALL MACHINES. This can be zero only if the ProdStandard is greater than zero. Default from OpStd.SetupHours * Machines.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.ProdStandard
member.summary:
The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master.
NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.StdFormat
member.summary:
Qualifier for the Production Standard field. The valid qualifiers are:
"HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - Minutes/Piece, "PH" - Pieces/Hour,
"PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour,
"OM" - Operations/Minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.StdBasis
member.summary:
A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor to the number of pieces. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000.
This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QProdLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.ProdLRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QSetupLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QProdBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QSetUpBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is, the more machines the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, NOT SETUP. The stored setup hours is a total for all machines. This stored number is divided by the number of machines when it is displayed on the screen during operation maintenance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. It's the number of people it physically takes to set up this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The number of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur on this operation. The scrap increase the Run quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a operation run quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.IUM
member.summary: Issue Unit of Measure. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8. Only Applicable when SubContract = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes. Default the QuoteDtl.PartNum or QuoteAsm.PartNum depending on the QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.Description
member.summary: Description of item to be sent to subcontractor.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for quote operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for subcontract costs. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the subcontract cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.AddlSetupHours
member.summary: Additional Setup Hours that will be required after a certain quantity has been run for this operation. The quantity at which this occurs is established in AddSetupQty field. The system determines the setup hours as SetupHrs + (Max((RunQty - AddlSetupQty,0))/AddlSetUpQty) * AddlSetupHours. Any fractional results of the AddlSetUpQty calcs are rounded up to the next whole number before multiplying by the AddlSetUpHours..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.AddlSetUpQty
member.summary: Additional Setup quantity indicates the quantity at which additional setup time will be incurred.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity per ONE of the End Part. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer). This does not include scrap quantity. The scrap will be determined as each quoting quantity is applied towards the operation during the cost calculations. The assembly qty is either the One if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq = 0 or (QuoteAsm.RequireQty) if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RFQNeeded
member.summary: A flag to indicate that this quote operation requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required. This only applies to subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.LaborEntryMethod
member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated) or "B" - Backflush.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RFQVendQuotes
member.summary: The number of vendor quotes that are required for this quote subcontract operation. Can be zero if RFQ(s) are not required.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.FAQty
member.summary: The quantity requested for first article inspection.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RFQNum
member.summary: RFQ number that the item is linked to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RFQLine
member.summary: The line number of this detail record on the RFQ. This number uniquely identifies the record within the RFQ. The number is not directly maintainable, it's assigned by the system when records are created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SetupGroup
member.summary: Used to group operation to save on setups.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.AnalysisCode
member.summary: Analysis Code

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.OpDesc
member.summary: Operation Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.GlbRFQ
member.summary: Global RFQ flag. Used in Consolidated Purchasing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.BrkQty07
member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. The quantity represents the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price/standard established in PBCost or PBStdRate arrays. Not all 5 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the unit cost/Standard to use by first calculating the Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the BreakQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost/PBStdRate is used else, EstUnitCost for subcontract ProdStandard is used for internal operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SNRequiredOpr
member.summary: Indicates whether serial numbers are required form this operation. When true the system will prompt in labor entry processes for the serial numbers that have been completed on this operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SNRequiredSubConShip
member.summary: Indicates whether serial numbers are required on subcontract ship for a subcontract operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SendAheadType
member.summary:
Determines the scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation, offset which will be either
calculated (or entered) on the primary operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces, percentage
of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The secondary operation
will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.PcQuoteOprRow.SendAheadOffset
member.summary:
Scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces,
percentage of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The
secondary operation will scheduled to start after the offset period.
